references.paper_title: OpenStreetView-5M: The Many Roads to Global Visual Geolocation
references.reason: This paper introduces a large-scale dataset for visual geolocation, addressing a key challenge in the field by providing a more comprehensive resource for model training and evaluation.
This technical report describes Qwen, a large vision-language model, which serves as a strong baseline for comparison in evaluating the performance of geolocation models.
This foundational paper demonstrates the few-shot learning capabilities of large language models, which are leveraged by the proposed GeoCoT framework for improved geolocation reasoning.

references.paper_title: Large language models are zero-shot reasoners
references.reason: This paper highlights the zero-shot reasoning abilities of large language models, a key capability utilized by the GeoCoT framework to enhance geolocation accuracy and interpretability.

references.paper_title: Chain-of-thought prompting elicits reasoning in large language models
references.reason: This work introduces the Chain-of-Thought prompting method, which is adapted and extended in the proposed GeoCoT framework to guide multi-step reasoning for improved geolocation performance.
